Event: HumanObservation
An action that occurs at some location d: An output of a human observation process.

Event: MachineObservation
An action that occurs at some location d: An output of a machine observation process.

Event: eventID
An action that occurs at some location d: An identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

Event: parentEventID
An action that occurs at some location d: An identifier for the broader Event that groups this and potentially other Events.

Event: fieldNumber
An action that occurs at some location d: An identifier given to the event in the field. Often serves as a link between field notes and the Event.

Event: eventDate
An action that occurs at some location d: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

Event: eventTime
An action that occurs at some location d: The time or interval during which an Event occurred. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

Event: startDayOfYear
An action that occurs at some location d: The earliest ordinal day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

Event: endDayOfYear
An action that occurs at some location d: The latest ordinal day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

Event: year
An action that occurs at some location d: The four-digit year in which the Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.

Event: month
An action that occurs at some location d: The ordinal month in which the Event occurred.

Event: day
An action that occurs at some location d: The integer day of the month on which the Event occurred.

Event: verbatimEventDate
An action that occurs at some location d: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for an Event.

Event: habitat
An action that occurs at some location d: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred.

Event: samplingProtocol
An action that occurs at some location d: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during an Event.

Event: samplingEffort
An action that occurs at some location d: The amount of effort expended during an Event.

Event: sampleSizeValue
An action that occurs at some location d: A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

Event: sampleSizeUnit
An action that occurs at some location d: The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

Event: fieldNotes
An action that occurs at some location d: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about the Event.

Event: eventRemarks
An action that occurs at some location d: Comments or notes about the Event.

Event: An action that occurs at some location during some time.

1963-03-08T14:07-0600 is 8 Mar 1963 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC,  "2009-02-20T08:40Z" is 20 Feb 2009 8:40am UTC,  "1809-02-12" is 12 Feb 1809,  "1906-06" is Jun 1906,  "1971" is just that year,  "2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z" is the interval between 1 Mar 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC,  "2007-11-13/15" is the interval between 13 Nov 2007 and 15 Nov 2007.
14:07-0600 is 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC,  "08:40:21Z" is 8:40:21am UTC,  "13:00:00Z/15:30:00Z" is the interval between 1pm UTC and 3:30pm UTC.
1 (=1 Jan),  "366" (=31 Dec),  "365" (=30 Dec in a leap year, 31 Dec in a non-leap year).
